newsitem.title: FRANCE: TENNIS-FERREIRA CRASHES OUT IN THE THIRD ROUND.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-FERREIRA CRASHES OUT IN THE THIRD ROUND.

text.p: Wayne Ferreira became the 10th seeded player to crash out of the Paris Open when he lost 6-2 6-4 to Swede Magnus Gustafsson in the third round on Thursday.
The eighth-seeded South African lasted just 59 minutes on centre court against the player who on Tuesday eliminated number nine seed Andre Agassi.

The result secured Boris Becker, upset by Spain's Carlos Moya in the second round on Wednesday, his berth in the eight-man ATP Tour World Championship in Hanover next month, where he will defend the title.
It also left Ferreira out of the running for the year-end event formerly known as the Masters.

Sixth-seeded Becker and top seed Pete Sampras, who on Sunday met in the Stuttgart Open final won by the German, were among nine seeds to fall at the first hurdle after getting a bye in the opening round.
